Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The issue is that myGetTransaction just randonly and only a very very small percentage of the time, does not return a tx when it in fact does exist.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: To get around this, I have changed the utxo selection everywhere to random loops

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: and if that check fails, i just skip it and any code that segfaults later because it was skipped

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this stops the node going on a fork and lets it keep betting, but I have no idea what the rammifications are...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: The amin issue stil seems to be the main pool, not actually minign transactions... Someone needs to either DDoS htat pool down until they fix it, or people need to stop mining there.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: Also if there was a way to call CC_EVAL during processing blocks, where it ignores mempool tx's that would likely fix the underlying cause also.

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It currently some how thinks a mempool tx invalidets a received block, which is very backwards lol

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: whether the tx are being mined or not should not affect the consensus bug. the problem with doing CC eval for the acceptmempool tx is that it will reject valid tx when dependent ones arrive out of order

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: yes. When I first started looking at it I was just going to try and add a boolean to CC_EVAL where it was called in connect block, but it does not work like that

Author: jl777c#5810

Author: blackjok3r#3181

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: your local txs in mempool make the received block invalid

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i dont see how that can happen

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: oh, wait

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: the onyl way to let the block connect is to skip the Unconformed TX call, or at least dont return a fail when it fails

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: my fix yesterday was that by accident...

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: chain seems to sync and doesnt fork so maybe it doesnt matter

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: on validating a block, all the tx in the block are put in to the mempool to remove any order dependent validation requirements

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but if in the mempool there are already some conflicting tx, it wouldnt be able to put some that are in the block into the mempool!

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this makes sense as its random txs and never the same ones.. they just disappear

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: requiring resync to get them back

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so we need to remove from the mempool any conflicting tx to the one coming from the block

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no wonder it is hard to fix

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: this one is very hard to fix

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: this is been the most annoying thing ive ever tried to fix

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: It seeems to work, then just braks again... very random

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes the local mempool could prevent the mined block from being mined

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i mean confirmed

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: thats what happens yes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: and then it ends up with tx in the mempool that are now orphaned, but the local node wont see that as it rejects the block that contradicts it

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: aha!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: so now we understand the causal factor for all the strange behavior!!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: in main.cpp there is a loop adding to the mempool in block validation

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: it actually does it iteratively as the tx in the block can be in any order

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: ok, a quick test idea!

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: before that loop, just clear the local mempool entirely

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: then there cant be anything conflicting in the mempool, the block confirms, node will not go on a fork or get stuck

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: ok sounds like a good idea, and probalbly wont cause anything bad either

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: do you want PR of what I have now ?

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: I have 2 nodes betting constantly for about an hour with no crash

Author: blackjok3r#3181
Content: but not sure what happens with more nodes

Author: jl777c#5810
Content:
if ( ASSETCHAINS_CC != 0 ) // CC contracts might refer to transactions in the current block, from a CC spend within the same block and out of order
4246 main.cpp, inside that if , clear the mempool before it does the loop

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: your method of randomly selecting utxo is a workaround, it reduces the chance from happening, but doesnt prevent things

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i think just adding the clearmempool might just stabilize things a lot as without it, the local mempool will cause properly mined blocks to be rejected

Author: blackjok3r#3181
